column4: I just noticed that my home directory had 755 for permissions.  Why would Ubuntu have that for default?  I changed to 750..  comments?
What is the danger in allows others on the system to read / execute your files?
It would not (assuming you're the owner).  It might annoy others
Keep in mind that opening a folder means executing it.  Same is true with viewing a picture file or listening to a song.
